utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: We will anger the Americans, slipping out like this.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: If your son was a student at one of the greatest universities in the world...

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: So make him come to you. You're protected near the UN. Once we cross 42nd Street...

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: As always, I appreciate your caution, Joseph, but, as always, you have far too much of it.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Stay down, sir. Get on the ground. Get on the ground.

utterance.speaker: Process Server
utterance.content: I'm just serving process. Your boss is being sued under title 18 of the United States code, section 1350, for genocide, crimes against humanity, and torture.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Mr. President. This is only a civil lawsuit. We can ignore it. Mr. President.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want us to work for Foreman?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not permanently. He is setting up interviews to replace Taub and Thirteen, but it might take a couple of weeks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, what happened to them?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He quit, and I had to let her go.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You actually fired your girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yes. You two are both competent, and I know I can work with you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You really do know how to woo.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I need you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It would be interesting. We could work together.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Did you see who the patient is?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's one of the reasons it'll be interesting.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Dibala is one of the most repressive dictators in the world.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You had no problem treating a guy on death row.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Who was still in prison after we patched him up. We fix Dibala, he gets on a plane and executes half his country. He's been repressing an ethnic rebellion in the south, the Sitibi people. It's getting worse.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Dibala is a guest of the US government. And he's been invited to speak at the UN. I’m not asking you to love him. I'm asking you to do your job.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Utterly incomprehensible. And, of course, I’m talking about you firing your girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We weren't getting along with her working under me.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: This'll help.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cameron and I work together.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But you weren't her boss. And you’ve stopped working together.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why don't you just tell her you were wrong?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 'Cause I wasn't. I know how this looks. I know it might break us up. But that's better than definitely breaking us up, which is what would have happened otherwise.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hemorrhagic ulcers in the lungs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God, it's three years ago. Does that mean I’m still crazy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're back?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You look good.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We're just helping out because –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. I just ran into Thirteen while she was clearing out her locker. My condolences. Although it's not like she's the hottest woman in the world.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We haven't broken up. Are you back?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sort of.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Did you get your license back?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not for a month or so. So you'll be in charge. I'm just gonna pitch in a little.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Dibala thinks it was an assassination attempt. Polonium, like the Russian guy in London.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: FBI checked the service of process forms and his hotel room. No radioactivity trails.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Acid reflux?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No history of asthma or heartburn.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He has a bug bite on his hands. Malaria's endemic in his country. Let's start him on coartem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't want to step on any toes, but I guess I do have a higher duty to the patient.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you have something to say, say it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're rushing to a diagnosis because you're rushing out of this room because you're rightly upset with me. Although I wasn't the one who made that asinine decision to –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Do you have anything medical to say?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Poison fits better because of the vomiting. Bug bite might not be a bite. It might be the start of chloracne.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Assassination attempt through dioxin poisoning. It's hard to detect. Fits.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Start him on olestra. You couldn't have just said dioxin up front?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was hoping you'd get there on your own. So I guess we should talk to Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: You are sure it is dioxin?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's our best guess. The olestra here binds to the poison, flushes it out of your system.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Where are you from, doctor?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm Australian.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Do I hear a bit of the British?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Most people don't notice it. Yeah, I-I kicked around there for a while.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: You went to medical school there?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Actually a year of seminary.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: And you left. Hmm, hmm. There was a Catholic mission near my childhood village. I liked the priests. They were good people. But when my two younger sisters were dying from consumption, it wasn't more priests we wanted.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I fired my girlfriend because he said he was gone for good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need this in my life.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: A week ago, it was the last thing you needed.

utterance.speaker: Houes
utterance.content: It's a process. I'm learning.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And screwing me over as you go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, that's why I did it. Sorry. If you want, I’ll explain it to Thirteen.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's not ready. He doesn't have his license.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then he can't practice. But we'd be idiots not to listen to him. You're in charge, he sits in on all the differentials. Until you get your license back, this is all unofficial. No procedures, no patient contact.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Think I can probably deal with that last one.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The only reason I let you go is because our relationship wouldn't work if I was in charge. But I won't be in charge soon, so... I came to offer you your old job back. I know. I look bad. But circumstances have changed.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't want the job.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Because there's a much simpler explanation for you firing me. You wanted to break up with me, but you were too weak to do it yourself.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Then why would I try to hire you back? Can we please get some dinner tonight?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Uh, you're a follow-up?

utterance.speaker: Ruwe
utterance.content: You must not treat him. Dibala killed my wife. She was a trade unionist. They took her from our home while I was at work.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Who took her?

utterance.speaker: Ruwe
utterance.content: Dibala's Youth Labor League. He pretends it's to get young people off the street. But he takes teenage boys from the provinces and feeds them drugs and alcohol and teaches them how to torture. They dumped her body in my yard two weeks later. They raped her. They carved inyenzi, cockroach, onto her stomach because she's Sitibi.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm very sorry, but I can't discuss other patients. You should talk to a lawyer, talk to the UN...

utterance.speaker: Ruwe
utterance.content: So they can sit and watch, like they did in Rwanda? There are 2 million Sitibi. He's planning to massacre them all. His radio stations are talking about a final war to exterminate the cockroaches. He can't recover.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How was your first day of school?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn't pee once in the sandbox.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How was it with Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did you think I was talking about? Hmmm. You didn't use garlic. You didn't use it last night either. We always use garlic on Chicken Florentine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It tastes fine this way.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You seem to be losing your sense of smell.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think you're losing your sense of mind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can check right now if you pull my finger.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, it's the – Are you inventing some big medical mystery here? Because if you're imagining things again...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You weren't wearing shoes last night either.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, shoes, garlic – I am vampire, Sookie.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I told you to get that echo fixed.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: My downstairs neighbor, after you moved in, started complaining about the extra noise and the cooking smells.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's his name?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't want you making things worse. He's on the condo board, and I’m trying to get the back garden renovated.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The white coats taught me a whole bunch of fun coping and relating skills.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's not only a total jerk. He's a decorated war hero who lost an arm in Vietnam. I mean, there's no winning with this guy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Coping skill number one… Complete avoidance. You happy? Booty call? Give me 20 minutes to not shower.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Patient's having a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mask at 15 liters.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Just thought you'd like to know.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Streptokinase, heparin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lassa fever. You were mad that I withheld it last time, so I’m saying it right up front. He's already stabilized, so 40 CCs of ribavirin, and we're home in time for Ellen.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I checked. There's no Lassa in Dibala's country.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The rash is gone. It rules out your dioxin theory. He's running a slight fever, which we can add to the heart, plus the lung ulcers.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ebola? Marburg?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Too long an incubation period. And…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't people sometimes travel? To places that have, you know, a fever that originated in the Nigerian town of Lassa?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's been to three other countries in the last two years: here, Zimbabwe, and Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt. No Lassa there either.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh. Again.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Trypanosomiasis?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No sleep disturbances. But fits best with the symptoms. And it's geographically the most – What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The Egypt visit was for the African Union Meeting, Where I’m guessing he was meeting people from Africa. Which includes Liberia, which sent some members of their Foreign Ministry, which has itself just been hit by an outbreak of jock itch. No, wait. Not jock itch. Lassa fever.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'll start the ribavirin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I did say it up front. It's great to have the old team back together again, huh?

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Yesterday, it's poisoning. Today, Lassa fever. Maybe a specialist –

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Joseph! Leave him alone. These people know what they are doing. Are you married, doctor?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: You have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Judging by your tentative answer and the complicated expression on her face, I believe that is she, standing in the hallway.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I got a call from Douglas' department at Princeton General. They want me to interview with them. Which is weird, because when I called last week, they said they had nothing available. So I never sent in my resume.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Douglas owes me a favor.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Most people send chocolates.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'd stand outside your apartment all night holding up a boom box, except you told me you hate '80s music.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So... about dinner, I'm free tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: I was wondering what that noise was. It's the damn cane.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And I’m Greg.

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: And I can't sleep with you banging around with that thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not actually saying that I have too loud a cane?

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: Is that hard for you to understand?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only in the sense that it has a rubber tip on the end, not a tap shoe.

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: Now you're getting cute with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, we started badly. I apologize for the noise, and we will try to figure out a way to be quieter –

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: And a thousand other things I don't give a crap about. Now you keep it down, or we're gonna have trouble.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You paged me?

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: This is Ama. She is from our country, but she lives here now. We'd like you to use her blood.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: She recovered from Lassa fever two years ago. Our health minister has advised us that plasma from one who has the antibodies is much more effective than ribavirin.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: This is a signed consent form. Will you take her blood, please?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Ama
utterance.content: I want to do this.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You understand that we would be using your blood to cure president Dibala.

utterance.speaker: Ama
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Are you from the Sitibi people?

utterance.speaker: Ama
utterance.content: I am Sitibi.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Did they threaten you in some way? Your-your family members back home?

utterance.speaker: Ama
utterance.content: Please let me give the blood. Please.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Do it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's being coerced.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If she is, I’d rather have a needle prick on my conscience than the death of her family members.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hey! Don't let him in there!

utterance.speaker: Bass
utterance.content: That's enough! We got him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hey! You all right?

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Who is that man?

utterance.speaker: Bass
utterance.content: He shot him?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You need a lawyer. You can get a court-appointed. They can help you.

utterance.speaker: Ruwe
utterance.content: I can't be helped.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You did a stupid, terrible thing. But given the circumstances with your wife… You could get a reduced sentence.

utterance.speaker: Ruwe
utterance.content: She wasn't my wife.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then who was she?

utterance.speaker: Ruwe
utterance.content: They never told us her name. What his men made us do to that woman… He is now going to do… to all the Sitibi.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You could have gotten killed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He wasn't going to hurt me.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He fired a gun in the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Come here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Maybe next time don't yell out that warning.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The bloody eye was from an enlarged lymph node blocking the retinal vein. We restored circulation, but it means we've got to add lymph involvement to the heart, lungs, and rising fever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm just gonna sit here quietly.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I feel like I’ve been inadvertently undermining your authority, so I’m just gonna observe. Not gonna say a word.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The heart could point to sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm thinking the x-rays indicate a lack of hilar adenopathy, which rules it out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Staph aureus?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. Because… He… Smokes?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's miming a thermometer. He says the fever's not high enough.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So some other infection.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's wrong. The fever could be misleading us into thinking infection.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Talk.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It could all fit with lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, I need you to spread your legs so I can do an “H.”

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Can't be lymphoma. LDH is normal.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's got good liver function. It's masking the elevated levels. Biopsy the lymph node. Check it out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Makes sense. I guess you don't need me. Oh, by the way, you might want to close the blinds. It’s really bright in here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's just a wild coincidence that he thought you were a rude jerk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on. Give me the benefit of the doubt. You said he's a jerk. I barely talked.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You talked! All I wanted was to sip morning espresso next to a peaceful, burbling fountain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You could be sipping Courvoisier next to a replica of the Playboy grotto if you tell him what you got on him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't have anything on him. I don't want anything on him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The closest he's been to Vietnam? Ordering the mee krob at that place on the corner.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Mee krob is from Thailand.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What did you do? Why do you think he's faking?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I saw his mail.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You broke in?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. He was holding it. Private medical insurance. Not from the VA. Plus, he's got to be early 50s. He's too young to be a vet. So I looked further.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You did break in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Online. There's no reference to him in any of the vet records.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why would he fake being a veteran?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just look how you're acting. People have been tiptoeing around this jerk for years.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Normally, we'd all tell the amputee to go screw himself.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Victims get pity, heroes get adulation. It's way better.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Thank you for trying to help me out with my neighbor. Now forget the Vietnam stuff.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I could prove this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But you won't because you'll be too busy writing him a letter of apology and dropping it at his door without knocking at his door.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn’t do anything, the guy’s a totally ass.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Which is the point. It's easy to be nice to people you like. But being nice to people you hate, that's a skill. Do it.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Thank you for saving my life.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The man that tried to kill you, he said that you were preparing a massacre.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: The Sitibi are my countrymen. I am fighting a guerilla war.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: In a way that's being called genocide.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: 20 years ago, these same Sitibi rebels took over the south. They massacred tens of thousands, and they would happily do it again. I'm trying to impose order. I'm trying to prevent a genocide. Genocide. My own son, my youngest, he is a student here. He hasn't spoken to me in years because of what he read in your newspapers. But what he read is not true.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What about your Youth Labor League?

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Ahhhhhh. There I was at fault. I hired men, who, in their zeal, stepped over the line, and there were abuses. But that will not happen again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How's it going?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Normal-looking nucleus.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How's it going with you? It worried me when you joked about letting that man shoot Dibala.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I wasn't joking.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You can't want to kill anyone, especially not your own patient.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's only natural to feel he should –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, it's completely unnatural. Only psychopaths can kill other people without having some sort of breakdown.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Not when it's justified. Look at soldiers.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Even when it's justified.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Am I trying to kill our patient? Of course not. But if he died, am I supposed to just pretend that wouldn't be good for the world? The cells are neatly differentiated. This isn't lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thought I had detected the sickly sweet smell of maple syrup and socialized medicine. It smells like… victory. That big flag in your place prompted me to chat with your housekeeper. Turns out you're a citizen of the Great White North.

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: You broke into my apartment?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Technically, no. Well, technically, yeah, but two steps. Hardly –

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: You're going to jail.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Speaking of, you know what can get you six months and a $100,000 fine? Falsely claiming that you won a medal in Vietnam.

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: You think I’m faking?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Canada did not send troops to fight in Vietnam, you idiot.

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: They sent troops to reinforce the '73 Peace Accords, Which is where I tried to free a 12-year-old boy who stepped on a land mine. 36 years later, every second, I feel the pain in my hand like I’m still grabbing that boy's arm, even though my arm isn't there. So, no, I’m not faking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh. On a related note, go Maple Leafs.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Did you get the biopsy results? Is it lymphoma?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. So we have to move on. Infection, perhaps autoimmune…

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Did you get the biopsy results?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes, I just told you.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Is it lymphoma?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Cameron and Chase?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: They both really like diagnostics. And I think they both really like watching House torture me. Anyway, thank you for understanding about the job. I had two really crappy alternatives.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: There was a third.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What's that?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You could have stepped aside.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We both would have lost our jobs.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You could have asked Cameron or Chase to take your place.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: They wouldn't have wanted to.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You just said they both really like diagnostics.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You want to go back in time?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I want to make this work. I want to understand you. I mean, you know how you made me feel. If you could do it again...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I made the right decision.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: I need your confidential medical opinion. Is the President capable of thinking clearly?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Obviously not, right now.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Will he ever be?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I think… Neurons don't grow back, and he's already in his decline. Anything he tells you, any command he gives, how will you ever know it's not just the delusions of a sick, mad, dying old man?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He just started spiking a fever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You don't have some clever way of telling me this time?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Patient's dying. I'm done with clever. Look at his skin. It's tight for a 75-year-old.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Based on his admission photo? Bit subjective. Fever points to infection. And now he's got nodules on his fingers. That's blastomycosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nodules? And you're calling tight skin subjective?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’m with Foreman. We would have seen fungus balls on the head CT.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fungal lesions can be missed.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We could settle this with a test. Anticentromere antibodies would point to scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Point to, not prove. And his fever's too high. We have to treat him now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We treat wrong, we could send this disease into overdrive. You're with me on the scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I guess. I just don't care enough about the patient to waste my time trying to convince anyone –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We get it. You don't like the guy, you didn't want to work on this case. And yet you're still here. Why don't you take a stand? Either do something about it or shut up.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Treat him for blasto if you want.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll get Cuddy. I can convince her to –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This isn't a democracy. I don't care who you get. At least for right now, this is my department. We're treating him for blasto. Start him on Amphotericin B.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Inject my IV with an air bubble.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: I will have another heart attack. No one will know.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Let her go.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: You tell my colonel I'm a sick, dying old man who can't be trusted.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I didn't say…

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: You were trying to put a gun in his hand and point it at my head. The gun is now in your hand. That is a practical difference, not a moral one. If you want me dead, then pull the trigger. It is not so easy when you have to do it yourself.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Allison.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I guess I didn't want you dead.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If you touch my wife again, I'll kick your ass out into the street. I don't care who you are.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: I did her a favor. I showed her her true character.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's a better person than you are.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: She is too weak to act on her beliefs. That is not her fault. Most everyone is. Even my own advisors. My own colonel. All they do is negotiate and debate and sign treaties. They are appeasers. And all the while, we are beset by assassins and traitors, the scum –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cockroaches? What are you going to do about them?

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: What is an enemy to you? Some younger physician who covets your office? In my world, there are dangers and bloodshed and death. And that makes you a man. And men make choices.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And your choice is to send bands of drunk, crazed children to massacre an entire people?

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Don't ask me questions you don't want to know the answer to.

utterance.speaker: Dibala
utterance.content: Whatever it takes to protect my country.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You broke into his apartment?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't break in.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I wish I believed you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can fix this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I already did. He was going to press charges. But… I promised him you'd leave.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're kicking me out?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'll explain it to your psychiatrist, but… yeah. You got to go somewhere else. House, I know when things go wrong, usually you just double down and get more involved, but here you could go to jail. And I truly believe that you've changed enough to know this is the right thing.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We need a blood sample. We got to do the anticentromere antibody test. It'll show House is right. It's scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why are you doing this now?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Because I didn't want to kill him. And you're right. I have to take a side. So I’m going to do what I can to keep him alive.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll get you the blood.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Positive for anticentromere antibodies.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I told you before, this only points to scleroderma. It doesn't prove it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're just gonna ignore the test?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Blasto still fits best.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I know it's not conclusive, but when you put it with all the other evidence –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I've made my decision.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Have you told Thirteen you were wrong to fire her?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What does that have to do with anything?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I've worked with you long enough to know you're reasonable. You can usually admit when you're wrong. But there's some deep part of you, that when you find you're wrong about the most important decisions you've made, you get insecure and you just retrench. If you want to mess up your relationship, that's your right, but you mess this up, our patient dies.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Switch him to steroids.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi, honey. How was your day?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Morning. First of all, my bad. I've gone through this whole thing recently. I don't want to bore you. Short version: I’m really trying to do work on some stuff. This is a definite setback. Although, in fairness, you really did make it tough.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Phantom pain in your missing arm? Five different kinds of painkiller in your medicine cabinet. That's what this magic box of neurological trickery is for.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This would be a lot easier if you do what the crazy guy who tied you up says. Put your hand in there. Put your hand in there. Now look. Mirror magic. Your arm is back. Now clench both your fists at the same time. Clench. Real hard. If you believe in God, pray that this is gonna work. You might also want to ask him why he blew off your arm. Ready? Now let go.

utterance.speaker: Murphy
utterance.content: Oh, my God. It relaxed. For 36 years, I’ve been in pain. And it's finally gone. Oh, my God. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: O2 sat's down to 88.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Going through the main stem bronchus, into the right upper lobe. Get them out of here.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Bleeder.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cauterizing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Got it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Get the paddles!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm going back in.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: What is happening?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's bleeding into his lungs.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Charging.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Another bleeder. I can get it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hold on. There's a third.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: God, there's a dozen. Shock him.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Clear. Charging. Clear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want to curl up and cry, the lounge chair's a little more comfy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I switched his meds. I thought I was wrong, so I took him off the antifungals. Put him on steroids like you said.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know what that means.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I was too late. Or I was right in the first place.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So either you killed him by not having confidence in your opinion, or you killed him by being too attached to your opinion. If you're anything like me – and, by the way, you are – you need to know which.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's under lock and key in the morgue. His government wants their own doctors to do the autopsy. They're taking his body out tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's a reason I hired you. You used to know what to do with a locked door.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I went down to the morgue to rerun the antibodies test.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We ran it twice.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Turns out I couldn't get in. They had an armed guard. But I saw this. It's a sign-in sheet from the morgue. Your signature. 9:45 this morning. That's right before you guys ran the test. What were you doing there?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Follow-up on a clinic case.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What case?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You think this is really important –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: One of the patients in the morgue was a 70-year-old woman who had scleroderma. You and Cameron, if you took that woman's blood, you could have messed up the test results so we treated Dibala for the wrong disease.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cameron had nothing to do with it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You son of a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He was going to kill the Sitibi. Every last one of them.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't care what he was going to do. He came to us and put his life in our hands.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: All the good we've done… Every life we've saved… It would have meant nothing… If we just sent him off to kill hundreds of thousands of people. Look at the news. The moderates are taking over. There's hope for peace talks. You tell the world that I faked this test, Dibala becomes a martyr. The massacres begin.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I cover this up, I become your accomplice. You think you can guilt me into that?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If the cops are going to come for me, please warn me… So that I can tell my wife first.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Chase… You really think you can kill another human being without any consequences to yourself?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: TV
utterance.content: American alligators are mostly found in the southeastern United States.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: My neighbor called. He sounded… happy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's nice.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Even nicer, he's approving the garden expansion.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And even more nicer… He's not going to press charges. Even if you don't move out. What did you do to him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was nice. You really want to know?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think… I want to give you the benefit of the doubt.

utterance.speaker: TV
utterance.content: Alligators’ main prey is very small animals that they can kill and eat in a single bite.

utterance.speaker: House and Wilson
utterance.content: Oh!
